text: first pokemon game i can remember playing clearly was ruby, got it for the gameboy advance sp when i was 7 for christmas and this song never got old haha..my cousin who i was very close wit had sapphire and then we both got emerald..loved generation 3<3
author: Stephen

text: you forget golden sun (:
author: Ash Williams

text: Ah, that's a shame. Imo the series has produced so many good games, both old and new. I thought Diamond & Pearl were awesome, Platinum improved on them even more, HeartGold & SoulSilver were brilliant remakes and still completely new at the same time, and Black & White I'm currently playing through and it's amazing so far. I'm really looking forward to Black & White 2. Emerald is still perhaps my favourite game, but one thing all Pokémon games have in common is - they all have amazing music. <3
author: articuno808

text:
D/P is kinda good, though probably the least of the series. B/W is very good, albeit with flaws but still really re-invigorates the vibe of the first one.
Can't say if B/W2 is gonna be worth it though, too little info and the info that is available doesn't seem too promising...

text:
RSE really has an underrated soundtrack. You should also put The Abandoned Ship on the list. Favorite track from this game. There are also some amazing remixes of it.

Oh, and play Pokémon Black/White. D/P/P were great games, but BW's way better.

text: This track stood out when I got to Mt. Pyre, in the same way that Lavender City did in the first Pokemon. Not as creepily memorable as Lavender, but I still like this theme's sadder tone. I haven't played a Pokemon game since this one.
